results.title: The Music lovers
results.creator_credit: Ken Russell and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Russell’s controversial biography of Tchaikovsky (Richard Chamberlain) is a flamboyant and visually kinetic attempt to match the romanticism of the composer’s music. Though talented, charismatic and handsome, Tchaikovsky’s life was compromised by confusion over his homosexuality. The film traces his disastrous marriage to Nina (Glenda Jackson) and the platonic love he shared with his wealthy patron, Countess Von Meck, a woman whom he never met. “The Music Lovers” is a wildly extravagant film that defies the conservative cinematic traditions of classical biography. Russell was to continue developing his expressionist music biographies over the 1970’s and this film with its astounding cast and exquisite representation of pre-revolutionary Russia is a masterpiece. The music is conducted by Andre Previn and the script is by Melvyn Bragg, based on the book “Beloved Friend” by Catherine Drinker Bowen and Barbara Von Meck.

results.title: The Music child. Parts 1 and 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Allen Parry and David Parry Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the possibilities that exist for eliciting language, basic communication and relationship activity with handicapped children through a special type of music therapy based on live musical improvisation. Gives a comprehensive overview of this special technique in a wide variety of situations with children at various levels of development.

results.title: The Music box
results.creator_credit: Barbara Tilley, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Barbara Tilley’s moving story starts with how she and her brother moved in with her older sister, Marge, to avoid being sent to a home. Ever since that moment, Marge has been the family rock, the one keeping everyone strong through the changes and sadness and keeping the family’s spirit alive.

results.title: The Music album: songs of the south
results.brief_description: This film is a compilation of songs originating from the southern states of America featuring “Showboat melodies” performed by The Marshalls including ‘I come from Alabama’, ‘Way down upon the Swanee River’ and ‘Campdown races’ and The Dixiairs performing ‘Waiting for the Robert E. Lee’ and ‘Dear old Southland’.

results.title: The Music album: songs of the Irish
results.brief_description: Three Irish songs sung with appropriate settings: 1. There’s nothing like the smile of the Irish. 2. Who threw the overalls in Mrs Murphy’s chowder? 3. It’s a great day for the Irish.

results.title: The Music album: snowtime serenade
results.creator_credit: United World Films and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Songs and music for winter performed by Gloria Jean, The Milt Herth Trio, The Sportsmen, Lee, Lynn and Lou and the Alpine Octes. The following are included: ‘Sly Old Gentleman’, ‘Jingle Bells’, ‘Winter Wonderland’, ‘Fireside Medley’, ‘Polka’.
